title: Checkbox values included in default values with `shouldUnregister: false` are not always removed when deselected
body:
**Describe the bug**
Deselecting a field array value that was included in the form's default values with `shouldUnregister: false`either does not remove the value or replaces it with a duplicated, already-selected value.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Go to https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-field-array-w-default-values-iqb4l?file=/src/index.js
2. Open the console
3. Click "Submit" to verify the default values shown in the console match the current selections
4. Deselect ID "3" and click submit; values are unchanged (`["1", "3"]`) when they should be `["1"]`.
5. Refresh
6. Deselect ID "1" and click submit; values are `["3", "3"]` when they should be `["3"]`

**Codesandbox link (Required)**

https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-field-array-w-default-values-iqb4l?file=/src/index.js

**Expected behavior**

Deselected values should not appear in the array, and there should be no duplicated values.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**

- OS: MacOS Catalina 10.15.7
- Browser: Chrome
- Version: 86.0.4240.183 (Official Build) (x86_64)

**Additional context**

May be related to #3431. Interestingly, if a new value is selected before deselecting one of the default values, deselecting seems to work as intended for exactly one value. If _two_ new values are selected before deselecting any of the default values, deselecting seems to work as intended for two values. I assume this pattern continues but did not test beyond two.

To illustrate using the codesandbox above:

1) Select "4"
2) Deselect "3"
3) Click submit; values are `["1", "4"]` as expected.
